Posts.Content: palmbreeze wrote: Three years after my first chemo, I thought I've been doing very well. Last week, I found out the cancer has returned. Frustrated and super disappointed. I can barely eat and sleep. I'm H2 positive and the growth rate is 70%. I've changed my diet ever since my first treatment, going organic and less meat. I can't think of what I could do differently to prevent this. Is bad gene the one to blame. If so, what can I do now to fight it? I'm waiting for port to put in and treatment to start. can I do anything at all? Here are my questions - 1. Starve the cancer? I'm 43. I heard that the younger you are, the faster the cancer grow and spread. Is there truth to this? If I eat less, will it help to slow/ starve the cancer down? If not, what should I eat at least I don't feed the devil. 2. Increase Alkaline or Ph level in the body? I also heard the cancer can't survive in alkaline environment. Has anyone actually done that? I asked my oncologist today and she was strongly discouraging that. She said my body can't tolerate. The alkaline will mess up how my body absorb protein. 3. Take any vitamin or herbs? Has anyone tried dandelion? Many thanks. Dx 4/10/2013, DCIS/IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Hormonal Therapy 5/13/2013 Chemotherapy 5/13/2013 Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 9/20/2013 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 10/18/2013 Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What caused cancer to recur? Do I have bad gene?! palmbreeze Coopdizzle

Posts.Content: palmbreeze wrote: Dear all, I have a very sensitive skin and have not had any sunburn experience. I'm starting radiation this Friday and have learned a few life saving Skincare products recommended by you ladies, my RO and from researching on internet. I wish to collect your thoughts on the following products. In your experience, how well did the following products work for you? I hope this one stop shop list with your validation will help other newbies like me to go through the radiation with minimum skin side affects. What do you use and how often you use them to be effective? Please add if yours is not on this list. 1. Over the Counter Skincare (gel, cream and or ointment) a. Oronine b. Briron calendula c. Aloe 2. Deodorant (vegan and free zinc/aluminum) a. Toms b. Secret Crystal Clear c. Arms & Hammers d. DeodeMom e. Sweet f. Thai g. Dessert Essence Dx 4/10/2013, DCIS/IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Hormonal Therapy 5/13/2013 Chemotherapy 5/13/2013 Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 9/20/2013 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 10/18/2013 Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: What caused cancer to recur? Do I have bad gene?! palmbreeze Coopdizzle

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2013 02:11AM palmbreeze wrote: Aryas, thank you for starting this topic.  I am very new to this forum yet after reading through all your posts, I feel I am in the right place. I am 40 and thought I have an excellent health until my mammo indicated macro calcification found with two 2cm lumps and two UA nods all on the left side.  I too have a mother who went through BC three years ago and with two young children of my own (22 months and 8 years old), I am truely frightened.  I am exhausted from researching, reading and headache from feeling down.  I am still waiting on biopsy result to tell me what stage I am in and what the treatment plan is.  I know I am ready to fight but with so many things required to plan and do, I don't know where I should start.  But I know I would like to work with a different doctor and here is why - I am currently working overseas for a month and will be back Dallas by the end of April.  A Hong Kong sergeon referred by Metilda said that I may need a removal.  I don't have MRI yet but the sergeon's tone sound commercial and it was depressing to hearing him issuing the "death sentence".  There was little optimistic in his tone other than "it is curable" (but I feel I am a big $ sign to him).   My husband said he did not have a good bedside manner at all.  I don't need someone to make me feel more worst than what it has already been.  This doctor makes me feel sad and very scared.  Anyway, thank you all for listening to me as I am learning how to cope this myself and get through this.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 11:00AM - edited Apr 12, 2013 11:01AM by palmbreeze AryaS, I am sorry that you have to do the mastectomy.  I heard from the doc today that you can preserve your own skin and nipple.  I actually want to hear more how myself. Looks like you and I are both in the 40's group and get DX almost the same time.  So I will stay close and you and I will go through this hand in hand.  At least you have your surgery date lined up.  Get some rest.  I tried to think that when I woke up from the surgery, I would feel much better knowing at least the cancer source were gone from my body.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 10:40AM palmbreeze wrote: Thank you AryaS and Christina.  I got my FNA Path result and confirmed my fear.  I have two lymp nods are MesC and two breast lumps are DuctC.  I am coming back to Dallas the end of next week and like Christina has suggested, I have my doctor appointment lined up to see as soon as I get back.  And I realize that getting things lined up is comforting.  Nonetheless, this doctor in Hong Kong said that I needed a mastectomy followed with a chemo.  I was more numb than crying but I could not help it when my husband told me that he is ready to shave his head.  At this point, I am so scared of hearing mastectomy and I don't know if I can feel the same way about myself after the mastectomy.  One the other hand, I have seen a lot of ladies on this forum have elected mastectomy.  Those who had lumpectomy have done mastectomy in some months later.  Was lumpectomy not as effective as mastectomy?  I may have to talk more with my doctor once I get back to Dallas but want to chat with you ladies about it.  I have not found the strength to tell my friends yet.  So I am so grateful you ladies here are hearing me out.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 11:37AM palmbreeze wrote: Kayb, yes makes sense and thank you for taking the time encouraging me.  I will take one day at the time but I am just afaid to go to see oncologist and hear more bad news.  Who knows it may be worst than what I know by far.  I am kind of running out of sponge that obsorbing all this news.  I dislike feeling this way.  I wish I could be strong like you ladies who can write a whole sentense without shed some tears on the words.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2013 09:29AM palmbreeze wrote: Gramwe, it is comforting to hear that.  I guess I am paranoid about the lymp nods are splitting as every minute goes by.  I had a fine niddle aspiration three days ago and I am feeling a bit hurt from those lumps.  I hope the FNA did not spread the cancer.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2013 09:22AM palmbreeze wrote: DWilli, it is only one semester and I know how hard it must have been for you to just stay away from your beloved job for one day. This is the one time you really need to take care yourself so please try to take a deep breath. I think my conversation with all you great ladies here helps to clear out my mind. The important thing is that we are making changes for good. I don't know how ready I am, I am not that strong. I lost sleep over thinking about all this. But I know that this battle has chosen me and I have no choice but put up a good fight to go through this hell in the next 7 months. AryaS, glad to hear that you will get these suckers out of your body soon. Me neither, I have never had any surgery. I pray for your successful surgery this Thursday. I actually cannot wait to do the surgery. I know it is much easier to say than done. I will probably be more freaked out when that time comes. I imagine I will have a deep nap and when I wake up, life is/should be better than what I am going through today...
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week AryaS dwill

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 11:19AM - edited Apr 12, 2013 11:19AM by palmbreeze Christina, looks like you have done all the therapy that it has out there.  Wow, you are my hero!  Hope I can see the end of the hell someday.
